(ANa) sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno'ti yā bhikkhūnaṃ adhisīlasaṅkhātā sikkhā, tañ'ca, yattha c'ete saha jīvanti, ekajīvikā sabhāgavuttino honti, taṃ bhagavatā paññattasikkhāpadasaṅkhātaṃ sājīvañ'ca tattha sikkhanabhāvena samāpanno'ti bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno.
Example1: yo pana bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpanno sikkhaṃ appaccakkhāya dubbalyaṃ anāvikatvā methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭiseveyya, antamaso tiracchānagatāya'pi, pārājiko hoti asaṃvāso.
Example 2: tasmiṃ bhagavati brahma-cariyaṃ carāma, bhikkhūnaṃ sikkhāsājīvasamāpannā

Example1: yathā no bhagavā byākarissati tathā naṃ dhāressāmā'ti.
Example 2: taṃ no brahma-cariyaṃ imassa kevalassa dukkhakkhandhassa antakiriyāya saṃvattatu

Example1: ajjhāvar’āmhā nandassa, bhoto santikam'āgatā
Example 2: te mayaṃ otiṇṇ'āmha'jātiyā jarāmaraṇena

Example1: sabb’upādāna-pariññāya dhammo - cakkhuñ’ca paṭicca rūpe ca uppajjati cakkhuviññāṇaṃ. tiṇṇaṃ saṅgati phasso.
Example 2: yesaṃ pariññāya dharamāno so bhagavā evaṃ bahulaṃ sāvake vineti

Example 2: seyyath’īdaṃ — cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro samma-ppadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañc’indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅgā ariyo aṭṭh’aṅgiko maggo.

Notes: (BDN) they are unshakable by their opposites: (1) the power of faith is unshakable by faithlessness (unbelief); (2) energy, by laziness; (3) mindfulness, by forgetfulness; (4) concentration, by distractedness; (5) wisdom, by ignorance. They represent, therefore, the aspect of firmness in the spiritual faculties.
Example 2: seyyath’īdaṃ — cattāro satipaṭṭhānā cattāro samma-ppadhānā cattāro iddhipādā pañc’indriyāni pañca balāni satta bojjhaṅgā ariyo aṭṭh’aṅgiko maggo.

Example 2: ‘saṃvissattho kho my’āyaṃ gahapati vā gahapatiputto vā’ti, atha naṃ rahogataṃ viditvā tiṇhena satthena jīvitā voropeyya.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: exactly like this; in exactly the same way; lit. thus indeed
Example1: evañ’hi sā yava-kalāpī suhatā assa chahi byābhaṅgīhi haññamānā. atha sattamo puriso āgaccheyya byābhaṅgi-hattho.
Example 2: evañ’hi so, bhikkhave, puriso oḷārikaṃ oḷārikaṃ iriyāpathaṃ abhinivajjetvā sukhumaṃ sukhumaṃ iriyāpathaṃ kappeyya.

seyyathā’pi eta’r’ahi paccu-ppannena rūpena khajjāmi
khippaññ’eva paccu-ṭṭhātabbaṃ
Example 2: manokammaṃ paccu-paṭṭhitaṃ hoti

Commentary:
ubbhida – welling up, lit. breaking up
uddhumātaka – swollen, lit. blown out
uggahīta - grasps, learns, lit. picks up
Notes:
uttāna - open, lit. spread out
uddhacca – agitation, lit. raised up
uppajjati – produces, causes to go out
Example1:
seyyathā’pi udaka-rahado ub-bhid’odako
ud-dhumātakaṃ vinīlakaṃ vipubbaka-jātaṃ
sūdo sakassa bhattu nimittaṃ ug-gaṇhāti
Example 2:
mayā dhammo ut-tāno vivaṭo pakāsito
ud-dhacca-kukkuccā cittaṃ parisodheti
āraddhavīriyassa up-pajjati pīti nirāmisā

Commentary:
nidhovati - washes off, cleans off, rinses off
nikkujjita – turned upside down, inverted
nijjhāna – insight, lit. think deeply into
Notes:
nikkhepa - putting down
nikubbetha – could bring down, humiliate
niggahita - restrained, lit. held back
Example1:
doṇiyaṃ ākiritvā dhovati sandhovati ni-ddhovati
ni-kkujjitaṃ vā ukkujjeyya
dhamma-ni-jjhāna-kkhantiyā sati chando jāyati
Example 2:
na paro paraṃ ni-kubbetha
kaḷevarassa ni-kkhepo jīvit’indriyass’upacchedo
vīriya-dhura-ni-ggahito

Commentary:
upagacchati – go towards
upanayhati – holds a grudge towards, lit. is bound up with
upaṭṭhahati – remains present, lit. stands near
Notes:
upādāna – grasping, taking near onself
upamā - similar to, like, lit. nearer to
upekkhā – mental poise, equanimity, lit. onlooking
Example1:
na orimaṃ tīraṃ upa-gacchatha
ye ca taṃ upa-nayhanti
vedanā uppajjanti, viditā upa-ṭṭhahanti
Example 2:
pañca-upā’dāna-kkhandhā
tatha-upa-maṃ sappurisaṃ vadāmi
upe’kkhā-sahagatena cetasā ekaṃ disaṃ

Commentary:
samatta – perfect, completely attained
saṃvāsa - living together with
saṅkhalikā – chain, lit. accumulated together
Notes:
sādhāraṇa – in common, same
saṃkhittena – in brief, lit. put together
santuṭṭhi – complete satisfaction, contentment
Example1:
ime dhammā sam-attā samādinnā
saṃ-vāsena kho, mahārāja, sīlaṃ veditabbaṃ
aṭṭhika-saṅ-khalikaṃ sa’maṃsa-lohitaṃ
Example 2:
sabrahmacārīhi appaṭivibhatta-bhogī sā-dhāraṇa-bhogī
bhagavā saṃ-khittena dhammaṃ desetu
san-tuṭṭhiyā saṃvattanti, no asantuṭṭhiyā

Commentary:
sucarita - right conduct
suciṇṇa - well practised, lit. well accumulated
suvinīta - well trained, good educated
Notes:
subhara - easy to supported
subhāsita - well spoken, articulate
sumedhasa – wise, having a good understanding
Example1:
‘tīṇi su-caritānī’tissa vacanīyaṃ
dhammo su-ciṇṇo sukham’āvahati
ariyadhamme su-vinīto
Example 2:
santussako ca su-bharo ca
su-bhāsitā ca yā vācā
ariyo su-medhaso

Example1: channaṃ phass’āyatanānaṃ samudayañ’ca atthaṅ’gamañ’ca a-ssādañ’ca ādīnavañ’ca nissaraṇañ’ca yathābhūtaṃ viditvā anupādā vimokkho.
Example 2: so sato’va a-ssasati, sato’va passasati. dīghaṃ vā a-ssasanto ‘dīghaṃ a-ssasāmī’ti pajānāti, dīghaṃ vā passasanto ‘dīghaṃ passasāmī’ti pajānāti

Example1: yad'api, bhikkhave, a-doso tad’api kusala-mūlaṃ; yad’api aduṭṭho abhisaṅkharoti kāyena vācāya manasā tad’api kusalaṃ
Example 2: sukhassa ca pahānā dukkhassa ca pahānā, pubb’eva somanassa-domanassānaṃ atthaṅ’gamā, a-dukkham’a-sukhaṃ upekkhā-sati-pārisuddhiṃ catutthaṃ jhānaṃ upasampajja viharati

Commentary:
atisīta - too cold
atisitvā - having bypassed, having overlooked
atīta - past, gone past
Notes:
atimānī – one who is proud, conceited
accaya - the death; lit. going beyond
Example1:
ati-sītan’ti, ati-uṇhan’ti, ati-sāyan’ti, ati-pāto’ti, ati-chāto’smī’ti, ati-dhāto’smī’ti
aṭṭīyati harāyati jigucchati attānaṃ’y’eva ati-sitvā
atī’tam’p’āhaṃ addhānaṃ evam’eva rūpena khajjiṃ
Example 2:
suvaco c’assa mudu, an’ati’mānī
so vo mam’acc-ayena satthā

Example1:
parikkhayaṃ pariy-ādānaṃ gaccheyya;
vivaṭena cetasā a-pariy-onaddhena
Example 2:
taca-pariy-anto pūro;
antamaso patta-pariy-āpanna-mattam’pi

Example1:
‘abhijjhālu vā an-abhijjhālu nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
byāpanna-citto vā abyāpanna-citto nu kho bahulaṃ viharāmi?
Example 2: tasmā’t’iha, bhikkhave, vīriyaṃ ārabhatha appattassa pattiyā, an-adhigatassa adhigamāya, asacchikatassa sacchikiriyāya.

Example1:
pāpimantaṃ gāthāhi pacca-bhāsi
paccavekkhaṇ’attho, bhante”ti.
Example 2:
te bhikkhū bhagavato pacca-ssosuṃ
ehipassiko opanayiko paccattaṃ veditabbo viññūhī’ti.

Meaning IN CONTEXT: augment added to some aorist and conditional verbs
Example1: ime kho hirī ca ottappañ'ca lokaṃ na pāleyyuṃ, sambhedaṃ loko a-gamissa, yathā aj’eḷakā kukkuṭa-sūkarā soṇa-siṅgālā.
Example 2: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekam’antaṃ a-ṭṭhāsi. ekam’antaṃ ṭhitā kho sā devatā bhagavantaṃ gāthāya ajjhabhāsi

Commentary:
palipanna – stuck (in), immersed (in), lit: gone completely
parihāyati – falls away (from), declines (in); lit: completely decreases
pariññāta – completely comprehended
Notes:
parisā – meeting, gathering, lit. sitting around
parivaṇṇayi – has praised all around
parikittana – hight praise, lit. praising all around
Example1:
paraṃ palipa-pali-pannaṃ uddharissatī’ti
saddhammā na pari-hāyati
kabaḷīkāre āhāre pari-ññāte pañcakāmaguṇiko
Example 2:
upaṭṭhāpenti pari-saṃ, kammato no ca dhammato
yaṃ buddha-seṭṭho pari-vaṇṇayī suciṃ
saṃvega-pari-kittana-pāṭhañca bhaṇāmase

Commentary: parāmaṭṭha – attached, lit. over touched
Notes:
parāyana – culminating in, sloping to, lit. going beyond
parakkama - striving, perseverance, lit: going through
Example1: evaṃ-gahitā evaṃ-parā-maṭṭhā evaṃ-gatikā
Example 2:
vihaṃsu tap’parā-yanā
purisa-thāmena purisa-vīriyena purisa-parakkamena

Base:
āgati – coming back, return
ālokite - looks at, looks forward
Construction:
āyatike - upcoming; lit: stretching forth
ātāpī - ardent, resolute, active
Example1:
atha kho yāvatā sattānaṃ ā-gati gati cuti upapatti
ā-lokite vilokite sampajāna-kārī
Example 2:
viratta-citta-ā-yatike bhavasmiṃ
kāye kāy’ānupassī viharati ā-tāpī sampajāno satimā

Commentary:
sadhana - rich, with wealth
sabhoga – wealthy, with possessions
sabrahmacārī - fellow monk, similar celibacy person
Notes:
sarāga - passionate, having lust
saphala - fruitful, having fruit
saudraya – advantageous, with result
Example1: puriso sa-dhano sa-bhogo kantār’addhāna-maggaṃ paṭipajjeyya.
Example 2:
viññū sa-brahmacārī sīlato na upavadantī’ti
virāgāya saṃvattanti, no sa-rāgāya
bhavissati sa-phalā sa-udrayā

Example1: seyyathā’pi usabho chinna-visāṇo sūrato sudanto suvinīto rathiyāya rathiyaṃ siṅghāṭakena siṅghāṭakaṃ anvā-hiṇḍanto na kiñci hiṃsati pādena vā visāṇena vā
Example 2: yatv’ādhikaraṇam’enaṃ cakkhu’ndriyaṃ asaṃvutaṃ viharantaṃ abhijjhādomanassā pāpakā akusalā dhammā anvā-ssaveyyuṃ tassa saṃvarāya paṭipajjāhi

Example1:
sudu-ddasaṃ sunipuṇaṃ, yatthakāma-nipātino,
cittaṃ rakkhetha medhāvī, cittaṃ guttaṃ sukh'āvahaṃ.
Example 2: ye ca kho sammad-akkhāte, dhamme dhamm’ānuvattino, te janā pāram’essanti, maccudheyyaṃ sudu-ttaraṃ.

Example1:
sodha sibbinim’acca-gā’ti
icc’evam accanta-namassanīyaṃ
Example 2:
yo-accanta-suddhabbara-ñāṇa-locano
so vo mam’accayena satthā

Commentary:
paṭikata – compensated, lit. made back
paṭikūla – repulsive, lit. against the slope
Notes:
paṭighāta - warding off, counteract, lit. beating back
paṭikkanta - returned, came back
paṭilābha - personal acquisition (of)
Example1:
mātāpitūnaṃ katañ’ca hoti paṭi-katañ’ca
āhāre paṭi-kūla-saññā
Example 2:
yāva’d’eva sītassa paṭi-ghātāya uṇhassa paṭi-ghātāya
abhikkante paṭi-kkante sampajānakārī
āyatanānaṃ paṭi-lābho, ayaṃ vuccati jāti

Commentary:
paggharanta - trickling
pamokkha - discharging
pavisati - enters
pasāda - inspiration, faith, lit: settle (mind) toward
Notes:
pajānāti – knows clearly
pabbajati - goes forth, ordains
padahati – strives, applies oneself, lit. puts forward
Example1:
chidda-avachiddaṃ uggharantaṃ pa-ggharantaṃ
na iti-vāda-ppa-mokkh’ānisaṃs’atthaṃ
nīca-cittaṃ’y’eva upaṭṭhapetvā pa-visati
dhamme avecca-ppa-sādena samannāgato hoti
Example 2:
‘dīghaṃ passasāmī’ti pa-jānāti
agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pa-bbajeyyan’ti
cittaṃ paggaṇhāti pa-dahati

Commentary:
abbhokāsa - open space, open air, ‘more visible’
abbhuggata – has came up, has spread about
abbhantara - inner being, lit: more inside
Example1:
taṃ kho pana bhavantaṃ gotamaṃ evaṃ kalyāṇo kittisaddo abbh-uggato
asampavedhī abbh-antarānaṃ guttiyā bāhirānaṃ paṭighātāya
Example 2: ‘sambādho ghar’āvāso rajopatho abbh-okāso pabbajjā
